args:
With the decisive battle in the capital at hand,
the prince renews his resolve by speaking with
a combat android who recently gained a heart.
Meanwhile, Harle and the Other lurk and wait;
the Other seems to be expecting something,
but what that may be remains unsaid.
By this time tomorrow, we will\nbe inside imperial territory.
You not feeling well or something,\n{player_name}? You seem down.
I just want to go take in some night air.\nI'll be back in just a bit, so you guys\nshould try to get some sleep.
Maaan, I sure hope he's okay.
Ain't no surprise about that—he's about\nto lead all of us into the wolf's den.
Boss's got a whole lot of weight\nridin' on his shoulders.
After we made it back from Lake Reeve,\nwe assembled our forces and started\nmarching for Sol Alberia.
Now we find ourselves camped just\noutside the Dyrenell Empire's territory,\nwith the decisive battle about to begin.
We're heading for the royal palace,\nand the throne where Morsayati waits.
Just hold on, Zethia. I'm going to defeat\nthe Other and get you back. ...I swear it.
(The fight that begins tomorrow will\ndecide everything.)
Wait, is this a combat android? I don't\nthink I've ever had one talk to me\nexcept for Mascula and Laxi.
So, um...hi there. Can I help you?
Goodness, now I'm making you guys worry\nin addition to Laxi and Mas... Hey, wait.
Did you just say you're\nWORRIED about me?
He looks quite surprised.\n▷Oh, he's surprised, all right.◁
What's going on here? I thought you two\nwere the only androids with a heart,\nbut if these others are worried for me...

▷It was once the case that we were the
only androids with a heart, but recently,
others of our kind have begun to exhibit
this type of behavior.◁
The cause is unknown. However, I surmise\nit may be connected to how Mascula's\nheart is housed within me.

▷As the commanding unit of the androids,
Laxi has a highly-developed faculty for
communicating and coordinating with
our siblings.◁
And Mascula's heart is more complex than\nmy own.
And you think that's affecting all the\nother androids somehow?

Yes. Irregular conditions have brought
upon unintended operations in them.
In my judgment, they are flawed.
▷Oh, are you KIDDING me?!◁
▷How can you not be happy about how\nyour siblings are changing and growing?\nI know I'M thrilled!◁
Hey, the more androids we get\nwho are like you two, the better.
▷Heh. Even their brand-new hearts\nknow enough to worry about you.◁
Affirmative. Myself, Mascula,\nand our brethren are all with you.
As such, there is no need for concern.\nMake haste and lead us to a world\nof total peace.
I do not understand.\n▷Yeah, what did we do?◁
I've been getting bogged down in details\nlately, and you just reminded me what it\nis that truly matters.
We're on the Empire's doorstep, everyone.\nAnd though the battle ahead will be fierce,\nwe set our sights to victory and forge on!
Looks like the boss shook free'a whatever\nit was what had him in the dumps, yeah?
Indeed, my darling's mien now carries its\nusual handsome and determined look!
Understood. We shall bring to you victory,\n{player_name}.
Today, we bring peace to our land.\nAll units...forwaaaaaard MARCH!
▷Am I crazy, or did the androids just\nact without waiting for your command?◁\nThis was my observation as well.
I surmise this to be another effect of\ntheir recent growth and development.\n▷So it's because of my heart?◁
It seems the New Alberian Army crossed\ninto our great Empire a short while ago.
Finally! I had grown quite weary\nof all this sitting about.
An opinion I most heartily share,\nYour Majesty.
You seem unable to hold back your grin,\nHarle. Are you truly so eager for this fight?

I forget myself before you, Majesty.
I fear my lips have a mind of their own
when it comes to the matter of what
is to transpire.
Will it be tragedy? Perhaps a comedy!\nAh, but war truly is the apex of all\nhuman amusements.

You are a capricious man to the last,
but pray do as you wish; I've little
interest in whatever motives play
behind that little smile of yours.
You may probe and churn as you wish—\nor turn tail, even, if the fancy strikes.
What a cruel thing to say to one who has\nonly ever prostrated himself before you\nin loyalty most abject!
Plot to your wretched heart's content,\nmummer! Only see that you do not\ninterfere with my plans.
But of course, Your Majesty.\nYour wishes are my own.
And as for the preparations for welcoming\nyour dearest brother, I am pleased to\nreport they are complete. Heh heh...
His intentions are as inscrutable as ever,\nbut no matter. If he manages to stop them,\nthen that's the end of that.
However, if they manage to make it all the\nway here...
